H0.text: Which Roman Emperor was allegedy killed by his wife, Aggripina, in AD54. Caligula

H1.text: Which Roman Emperor was allegedy killed by his wife, Aggripina, in AD54. Nero

H2.text: Which Roman Emperor was allegedy killed by his wife, Aggripina, in AD54. Tiberius

H3.text: Which Roman Emperor was allegedy killed by his wife, Aggripina, in AD54. Claudius

A4.text: Ancient historians agree that Claudius was murdered by poison – possibly contained in mushrooms or on a feather (ostensibly put down his throat to induce vomiting) – and died in the early hours of 13 October 54.

A5.text: Some historians have cast doubt on whether Claudius was murdered or merely died from illness or old age.

A6.text: Claudius died in AD 54 under suspicious circumstances, potentially poisoned by Agrippina herself.

A7.text: Nero had her murdered following an unsuccessful attempt on her life on a boat.
